item.title: NHS waiting lists could rise to 14 million in England next year - report
item.description: Currently five million people are on hospital waiting lists, but there is a warning of a hidden backlog.

item.title: Geronimo the Alpaca must be put down to protect cows - minister
item.description: Putting animals down is soul-destroying but necessary to stop bovine TB, the environment secretary says.

item.title: Wood Green stabbing: Police officers and social worker attacked
item.description: Three people are arrested after the social worker and officers were attacked in north London.

item.title: Community Shield: Leicester City 1-0 Manchester City - Kelechi Iheanacho penalty seals silverware
item.description: Substitute Kelechi Iheanacho confidently despatches a late penalty as Leicester stun Manchester City to claim the Community Shield at Wembley.

item.title: East Midlands Airport passenger tried to board plane via luggage belt
item.description: The man had become "animated" at the airport check-in desk after arriving late for his flight.

item.title: Jalsa Salana: Thousands head to Alton farm religious gathering
item.description: The three-day Jalsa Salana usually attracts 35,000 people but this year has been scaled back.

item.title: Sherwood Forest naked ramblers leave locals hot under collar
item.description: One regular visitor to Sherwood Forest says he finds it offensive seeing the nude walkers.

item.title: Mel Nicholls: Handcycling paralympian starts round-Britain challenge
item.description: Gloucestershire's Mel Nicholls wants to set a record for the furthest anyone has handcycled alone.

item.title: Covid: Newcastle United fans offered vaccines at home games
item.description: The vaccine bus will be outside the ground at Newcastle United's next two home matches.

item.title: Nottinghamshire tandem rally attracts 200 riders post-pandemic
item.description: Enthusiasts of the bicycle made for two have spent the week pedalling around Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Plaque for World War One soldier who returned from Canada
item.description: George Schultz returned to Merseyside from Canada in response to a call for volunteers.

item.title: Search for missing University of Oxford staff member
item.description: People are being urged to check cars and sheds to see if Derek Brant has taken shelter in them.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: How golf helped a Holocaust survivor
item.description: The club was set up for Jewish people to enjoy golf and is about to celebrate its 90th anniversary.

item.title: Covid in Bradford: 'I just want to see mum and dad one last time'
item.description: Young people in Bradford share their intense experiences of the Covid pandemic in an inner city.

item.title: Covid: Man, 23, 'thought body could brush off virus'
item.description: Patients at the Royal Liverpool Hospital tell BBC North West Tonight about being ill with Covid.

item.title: London riots: 'My shop was burned down but we came back stronger'
item.description: Trevor Reeves and Bushra Ahmed both lost businesses during a night of violence in August 2011.

item.title: 'I proved them wrong'
item.description: John Noble's recovery from an accident which left him with severe injuries has been described as a "miracle".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai wins men's flyweight boxing gold with victory over Carlo Paalam
item.description: Britain's Galal Yafai wins Olympic gold in the men's 52kg flyweight boxing competition with a win over Carlo Paalam of the Philippines.

item.title: Coins predating Magna Carta donated to Coventry museum
item.description: The coins were found by detectorists in a Warwickshire field and will be displayed in Coventry.

item.title: National Memorial Arboretum event off after military band told to isolate
item.description: The National Memorial Arboretum is forced to cancel its Summer Proms after a positive Covid case.

item.title: Bat killed by cat after record 1,200-mile journey
item.description: A record-breaking bat - the size of a human thumb - is discovered in Russia after flying from London.

item.title: North Kent coast sewage leak prompts 'stay out of the sea' warning
item.description: Southern Water said a system fault at a pumping station led to waste water entering a nearby brook.

item.title: St Bees great-grandmother, 87, reunited with lost wedding ring
item.description: Ursula Rowlands was so thrilled when it was found in the soil, she put it straight on her finger.

item.title: Superb Root hundred gives England hope against India
item.description: Joe Root strokes a century of the highest class to give England hope of beating India in a see-saw first Test at Trent Bridge.

item.title: Lincoln's Bramall suffers alleged racist abuse at Gillingham
item.description: Lincoln City defender Cohen Bramall allegedly suffers racist abuse from a fan at Gillingham.

item.title: Romelu Lukaku: Chelsea close to sealing club-record £97.5m deal for Inter Milan striker
item.description: Chelsea are close to sealing a deal to re-sign striker Romelu Lukaku for a club-record fee of £97.5m from Inter Milan.

item.title: Sheffield United 0-1 Birmingham City: Maxime Colin header gives visitors opening day win
item.description: Relegated Sheffield United fall to defeat by Birmingham City on the opening weekend of the Championship season.
